txt.en: You clear the path, making it safe for the horses to pass

'Let us see if we can get a look at what Théoden is doing. I will use my natural sneakiness to remain out of sight, but I cannot bear not knowing what is going on!\n\n'The King is meeting with his advisors in a clearing to the south-west. It is not far!'
You clear the path, making it safe for the horses to pass
You clear the path, making it safe for the horses to pass
You clear the path, making it safe for the horses to pass
Théoden meets with his advisors in a clearing at the base of Eilenach, in Taur Drúadan.

'I am sick of waiting around! Let us see if we can get a look at what Théoden is doing. I will use my natural sneakiness to remain out of sight, but I cannot bear not knowing what is going on!\n\n'The King is meeting with his advisors in a clearing to the south-west. It is not far!'
DNT - Blah!
Talk to Éomer at the southern end of Stonewain Valley
'DNT - Blah!'
There is trouble on the road ahead. If the Rohirrim are to come to Pelennor in time, they will need another plan.
'DNT - Blah!'

'I understand we have you to thank for sending to us these Woses, these Wild Men, [placeholder]. Their hatred of Orcs is similar to our own, and quite useful in this case, for the Orcs have made camp in the shadow of Amon Dîn and block our road.

'My six thousand spears could scatter this Orc barricade, but it would take time, and that time cannot be spared. Ghân-buri-Ghân says there is fire on the plain before Minas Tirith, and within the walls. The defenders will not last if we do not come soon.

'Ghân-buri-Ghân says he knows a secret way around the Orc camp. He says he can show us a forgotten road that will get us near to the city without delay. We must take this road!'

'My uncle has spoken with the leader of these Woses, these Wild Men, and has accepted their aid. Ghân-buri-Ghân speaks of a secret way that will allow us to skirt the Orcs blocking the road beneath Amon Dîn.\n\n'He has staked his life upon it, for he will walk beside Théoden on this secret way. If he proves false, I am to kill him where he stands. If this is a trick, I will slay him without hesitation.'
As you approach, you see that Théoden speaks with Ghân-buri-Ghân
DNT - Blah!

'Ghân-buri-Ghân make promise to you, [placeholder]. Now Ghân fulfill it. Wild Men will help Horse-men.

'Stonehouse-folk once very strong. Carved stones from hills. Carried stones on large wains. Built stonehouses on side of mountain. Road still there, but Stonehouse-folk forget. Wild Men not forget.

'Horse-men pass through Stonewain Valley. Entrance is north-east of Drû Bhûta, far south of here. Way is rocky. Clear stones from path to make safe for Horse-men's passage. Then Horse-men and [placeholder] fight gorgûn in front of great Stone-city. Wild Men live in peace.'
The entrance to the Stonewain Valley is far south of the Rohirrim encampment, and north-east of Drû Bhûta.
'DNT - Blah!'
DNT - Blah!
The Stonewain Valley runs north and south, not far from Drû Bhûta, in Taur Drúadan.
The Stonewain Valley runs north and south, not far from Drû Bhûta, in Taur Drúadan.
The Stonewain Valley runs north and south, not far from Drû Bhûta, in Taur Drúadan.
DNT - Blah!
'Ghân-buri-Ghân has proven trustworthy, [placeholder]. We are fortunate he came to our aid!\n\n'We may have come here just in time. Minas Tirith is not yet taken!'
Book 5, Chapter 7: Through the Stonewain Vale

Théoden meets with his advisors in a clearing at the base of Eilenach, in Taur Drúadan.
Ghân-buri-Ghân is meeting with Théoden and his advisors in Taur Drúadan.

'Horse-men pass through Stonewain Valley. Entrance is north-east of Drû Bhûta, far south of here. Way is rocky. Clear stones from path to make safe for Horse-men's passage. Then Horse-men and [placeholder] fight gorgûn in front of great Stone-city. Wild Men live in peace.'
The Stonewain Valley runs north and south, not far from Drû Bhûta, in Taur Drúadan.
Find the clearing where Théoden meets with his advisors
Éomer is at the southern end of the Stonewain Valley.
'I am sick of waiting around!'

Talk to Éomer outside Théoden's tent in Taur Drúadan
'I thank you for sending to us these Woses, these Wild Men.'
Talk to Théoden outside his tent in Taur Drúadan
'These Wild Men have offered their aid to us.'
'Secret way is rocky. You help clear.'
Talk to Ghân-buri-Ghân while he meets with Théoden
'Ghân-buri-Ghân has proven trustworthy.'
